lines.text: Keep my name outta your mouth.
My crib's upstairs.
You sleep in a crib?
I just want you to know I used to be a virgin.
What ya got there Nick?
Nothin'.
[Finds a pair of women's pumps in Nick's suitcase]
Gimme those, they're mine.
What the hell? You a fruiter?
No, they're not mine, they're for somebody else.
Where'd you get the money for these? You steal em?
No, I didn't...
Yeah, you did too, for her right? Huh?
[Jack lifts the women's pumps and Marijuana drops out of them]
You can put me back in the joint for this.
I'll get rid of them.
No, *I'll* rid of them.
[Jack throws the women's pumps]

[Jack goes over and drops his cigarette in the toilet and puts the Marijuana in his pocket]
What are ya messing' with that Weed for?
[Nick doesn't look at Jack]
Look at me when I'm talkin' to you!
Marijuana has medicinal purposes.
Well, how do you know?
[Jack smacks Nick across the head]
I read it in a book.
That's the biggest bunch of bullshit I ever heard. What else are ya doin'? Let me see your arms.
Get off my back I stole them cause I'm saving my money for Alaska.
Oh, I see. That's real smart. You land in Juvie., I'll go north myself back to Plan A.
[Nick pulls some money out of his boot]
Where'd you get this?
I didn't steal it. I earned it. For our tickets.
Evicted... huh... well... that's it... flat broke... 3 days we'll be hugging the pavement... eh it's all fucked.
We can't give up Jack, We'll get there.
Yeah, after 8,000 more fuckin' windows.
What are ya talkin' about?
My job, boy. Washin' windows
Washing windows? You said you had a job in construction, you're a building supervisor.
So I lied! Ain't the first time.
All you've been doing to me is lying to me since the day you left me there back at the bus station.
Put your mouth in park, leave and get in your room.

[Yelling]
I don't have a room!

[Screaming]
Well, then get out!
[Yelling]
Your cramping my style.
[Nick runs towards his suit case and frantically starts to put tings in it]
Where you goin'? I'm talkin' to you!
You're a fuck up and you're gonna fuck me up too!
[Jack punches at Nick but misses]
[Nick lunges at Jack]
[Nick tries to save the picture of his mother, but Jack throws the picture and it breaks]
Don't bother with that! It only looks like your mother. See what she was... a whore. A $5.00 street whore.
[Nick takes Jack's ukelele and smashes it against the bed]
[Nick then leaves and Jack starts crying]

[Jack is coughing because of the smoke from the hot dogs on the grill]
Oh!
Am I the only one in here who can't breathe?
Alright Nick, we're getting fixicated in here. Open that window.
Oh.
Here.
[Jack hands one of them a hot dog on a bun]
Is there any Ketchup?
Oh. Uh- ooh.
[Charlotte gets out of the car to get the Ketchup]

[to Nick]
You were staring at her like a Goddamn yard bull. That's one fine lady, what do you got to say for yourself?
She going to Alaska with you?
Nobody's going with me. Start acting like a stand up kid. Don't aggravate me.

[Charlotte gets back into the car]
Whoa.
Here.
[Jack hand the Ketchup to Nick]

[Mumbles]
Thanks lady.
[Jack smacks Nick in the back of the head]
Charlotte.
That's me. Lady Charlotte.
Well.
[Jack takes a bite of the hot dog]
Best damn hot dog I ever had. Excuse me for eating with food in my mouth.
Pulley Fuss. It's a funny name.
It's French. Pouilly-Fuissé.
How much this cost?
30 bucks?

[to Charlotte]
Here's to you.
Here's to me.
You like your dogs? Hey. I'm talkin' to you.
Yeah. cool. I like it.

I was afraid something like this was going to happen. His mother was a mess. I mean he was coming along learning stuff, he had a hell of potential that kid coulda, been anything. what happened to him?
He isn't dead.
No not yet.
Why do you think he's out there?
Well, he started hangin' out with that chippy downstairs and and those street punks and next thing hes coming home with a pair of high heels. The rest is history.
You don't think that filling up that boys head with dreams and them kicking him out on his ass had anything to do with it.

Hey, when he came to me, he didn't have any dreams! He had nothin' he had a picture of a pig. Don't pin that rap on me, I'm out there bustin' my hump while this little wise ass punk is out there feavin'... gettin' mouthy. I take him in, he gets mouthy.
You miss him.

It's all fallin' apart on him. Hm. I was afraid in prison... now... I'm really scared. Heh. I don't know if I can help the kid. I don't know if I have anything good to give him. He needs so much. This is no good I gotta turn this around. Get some money quick.
How are ya going to do that?
Oh I got my ways.
Are we going back to jailhouse correspondence?
I gotta split.

[to Nick]
You keep me straight, I keep you straight.
I- I can explain this, Normandy. What, do you think I am, a pervert?
Dating 16-year old's is one thing, but she's 12 and a day!
15 will get him 20! Stay put.
Normandy, I- I wasn't in the rack with her and I never even seen her before.
What'd you do? Black out, Jack?
It-it, see, it's my kid.
I thought you had a son? Turn around, Jack.
Normandy, please.
Get em' up.
Shit. Man, don't bust me.
What do you expect, man? You missed your appointment yesterday.
[Nick enters the room]
You don't show up at work today, And I come to your place and you drunk. With a minor in the middle of the day.
Dad? This is Molly.
Nick, this is my parole officer.
Somebody tell me what the hell is going on here?
She lives downstairs and needed a place to sleep last night.
I'm ballin'. Creama, c'mon.
Hey!
[to Jack]
I thought your son was staying at your sisters.
We're working on a relationship kinda thing, i figured, why prognosticate?
Procrastinate.
So why'd you miss the appointment?
[Jack sits there with his mouth hanging open]
He was helping me register for school.
I- that's right, this kid's gotta get an education.
What high school you put him in?
Garfield.
That's right.
You're not gonna arrest him sir? Are ya? We're jst starting out, he's a real good guy.
I need to know you can handle this.
I can handle this.
You sure you can handle this?
Yes, sir.
[Normandy takes the handcuffs off Jack and gives him a urine test cup]

[to Nick]
Outta the way.
[Normandy puts on a latex glove and Jack gives Normandy the cup]
Jack, you'd better mind how you go.
Yes, sir.
See you in my office in a week.

[to Nick]
And you take care, lil' brother.
[Normandy leaves]
We got outta that jam, huh?
I wouldn't have been it in the first place if it wasn't for you.
